properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 17 at 3:15AM PST until January 18 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...ANOTHER WINTER STORM SYSTEM FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...

.The next winter storm system will spread light snow over the area
beginning tonight. Snow will intensify Saturday morning before
tapering off in the late afternoon. Heavy snow accumulations are
possible in the Cascades and adjacent Columbia Basin areas as well
as the Okanogan Highlands.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8
inches possible.

* WHERE...Republic, Inchelium, Wauconda, Chesaw Road, Highway 20
Wauconda Summit, Boulder Creek Road, and Sherman Pass.

* WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and heavy snow
accumulations.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING
